result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah Louise Abbett

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Sarah Louise Abbett in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Sarah Louise Abbett.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls Officer Matthew Swanson, Superior Police Officer. Matthew Swanson is sworn and testifies. State direct examines the witness. Incident occurred in Douglas County, WI. Witness identifies the defendant. Attorney Hoffman cross examines the witness. State objection, relevance. State redirect examines the witness. State asks for bind over. Attorney Hoffman opposes bind over. 

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with AMK. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol.

2:10 PM Defendant Sarah Louise Abbett appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Sarah Louise Abbett. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $750 cash. No contact with AMK. No use or possession of alcohol. Notes violent charges alleged and is on supervision in MN. No FTAs. Notes prior convictions all out of MN. Attorney Hoffman notes defendant has lived at the address for the last 6 years and has extended family and children in the area. Defendant has local employment. Defendant can post up to $250. Court notes concerns over prior convictions and being on supervision in MN and FTAs.
Court orders $750 cash bail. No contact with AMK. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol. 
Defendant indicates that she qualifies for public defender representation.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
